cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 395 mi SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Drifting north-northeast today, then accelerating northeast across Florida’s Big Bend Thursday-night and emerging into the Atlantic near the GA/SC coast early Saturday, thereafter tracking northeastward just offshore the Mid-Atlantic and New England coasts.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Marineland, FL to Altamaha Sound, GA (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Anclote River to Walton/Bay County line, FL (Tropical Storm Warning); Anclote River to Indian Pass, FL (Hurricane Watch)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend and Panhandle, then Atlantic coast from Georgia through the Carolinas and northward toward New England
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤17%) of tropical-storm-force winds; peak onset probability 10% around Friday morning.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the east-central Florida coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands from Hermine could drop 5–10 inches with isolated higher totals over east-central Florida, including Port Canaveral, mainly Thursday night-Friday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible in outer rain bands Thursday night into Friday.
